title: Peter Faith
author: Peter Faith
content: Music is something that connects the body, spirit and soul.listening to a particular song can affect us negatively or positively.That is why in my own opinion we should be mindful of some set of songs..For example if your a Christian we should only listen to what edifies you...songs that will remind you of your place in Christ ,the life to come here after.likewise other believes. I rest my case

comments.author: boyptc
comments.body: I agree about being a Christian and you should be dwelling into Christian music because it uplifts your soul. About listening to music, I feel nostalgic when I hear music from the past and it reminds me of my youth and childhood. I can't stop but to reminisce those moments when life was too simple and easy going. I guess just like everyone else who has a way to escape reality, music is one of it and I feel like I'm going back in the past by listening to those songs including those that are uplifting my spirit too.

comments.author: mich
comments.body: Well I like to listen to Classical music when I am working. I just feel it makes my brain work better, but not that it makes me any more smarter. Mozart, Beethoven, and Bach are to name a few. I use to believe in the 'mozart effect'. But now I do not think it is a real thing. This types of music just help me.

comments.author: julerz12
comments.body: Quote from: Peter Faith on October 22, 2023, 05:08:02 PMMusic is something that connects the body, spirit and soul.listening to a particular song can affect us negatively or positively.That is why in my own opinion we should be mindful of some set of songs..For example if your a Christian we should only listen to what edifies you...songs that will remind you of your place in Christ ,the life to come here after.likewise other believes. I rest my caseTrue, I think we are drawn to listen to a particular genre of music depending on our state of emotion. If you're sad, most people just listen to even sadder songs (oh how I remember those Emo days in college LMAO). If you're at a party or just in an overall good mood, pretty sure no one would play music that's very depressing; It'll be upbeat music plus some head nodding or occasional dancing.  It's like music is a way to express your feelings, an extension of what you currently feel.For me, when I'm angry, I like to blast heavy metal or just rock songs; anything that'll drown out other noise.   \m/

comments.author: Hewlet
comments.body: For me, music calms my nerves down and it's one of my greatest antidotes to a stressful day. Of course, like most people, I have my genres of music and it is what fills up my phone space so I don't do random music that much.What I do most of the time is that depending on my mode, I can decide to listen to a particular artist for the day and I just go to my boom play and I search for the name of the artist and play his album and the vibs just goes on from there. Because I was brought up in a religious background, I don't listen to hip hop that much although I still know most of the songs I enjoy classical and country songs because they lift my soul whenever I listen to them. Talking about a particular kind of music affect effect on me isn't strange to me because based on my belief system most don'tdon't I avn the ones that uplift my soul.
